feedback.Physical Object: Excluded — A lava flow is a dynamic, unbounded process, not a discrete or static object.
feedback.Synthetic: Excluded — Naturally occurring, not created or altered by human design.
feedback.Biological/Biomimetic: Excluded — Has no biological origin or biomimetic design.
feedback.Powered: Excluded — It contains energy but is not powered by a designed input source.
feedback.Structural: Included — It reshapes terrain and can form structural features like solidified layers and landforms.
feedback.Observable: Included — Easily detected visually and thermally; observable by both humans and instruments.
feedback.Physical Medium: Included — Composed of physical matter, occupying space and made of molten rock.
feedback.Active: Excluded — It does not initiate behavior autonomously; changes result from external forces.
feedback.Intentionally Designed: Excluded — It has no intentional structure or purpose.
feedback.Outputs Effect: Included — Emits heat, light, and mechanical force; alters environments through direct effects.
feedback.Processes Signals/Logic: Excluded — It does not interpret or transform informational content.
feedback.State-Transforming: Included — Undergoes phase changes, solidifies, and chemically alters as it flows.
feedback.Human-Interactive: Excluded — Any interaction is incidental or hazardous, not designed for human engagement.
feedback.System-integrated: Excluded — Not inherently part of an integrated system or network.
feedback.Functionally Autonomous: Excluded — Behavior results from physics, not internal logic or control.
feedback.System-Essential: Excluded — It is not a required component of a defined system.
feedback.Symbolic: Excluded — While culturally interpreted as symbolic, it is not inherently a symbol.
feedback.Signalling: Included — Its presence signals volcanic activity or environmental change, even without symbolic meaning.
feedback.Rule-governed: Excluded — Follows physical laws but no abstract or logical rules.
feedback.Compositional: Excluded — Not hierarchically modular or component-based.
feedback.Normative: Excluded — Does not direct or constrain behavior intrinsically.
feedback.Meta: Excluded — Does not refer to itself or any abstract system.
feedback.Temporal: Included — Its identity as a flow is defined by time-based transformation and motion.
feedback.Digital/Virtual: Excluded — Entirely physical, not abstracted or simulated.
feedback.Social Construct: Excluded — Exists independently of social belief or consensus.
feedback.Institutionally Defined: Excluded — Not defined by institutional categories.
feedback.Identity-Linked: Excluded — Not tied to personal, group, or role-based identity.
feedback.Regulated: Excluded — Not subject to laws or governance.
feedback.Economically Significant: Excluded — May affect economies, but is not economically defined.
feedback.Politicised: Excluded — Not intrinsically tied to political conflict or governance.
feedback.Ritualised: Excluded — Ceremonial uses relate to interpretation, not the lava itself.
feedback.Ethically Significant: Included — Its impact on human life and ecosystems makes it ethically relevant.

encoding_notes: This encoding treats lava flow strictly as a physical geologic process — not as a symbolic, cultural, or mythic construct. Interpretive overlays (e.g., ritual, symbolism) are excluded as external attributions. Traits are selected based solely on the entity’s intrinsic properties and operation.
